#: on behalf of markhoebeke :: 6/2/2005 2:55 PM :#
> Hi, 
> 
> I'm quite new to Junit ant want to use Eclipse to carry out unit
> testing of modules using AspectJ.
> 
> However, as far as I understand, when the unit tests created in the
> Eclipse IDE are run, they are first compiled in the projects bin
> directory. A have found no way to customize the way they are compiled
> to use the AspectJ specific compilers. Hence, I cannot benefit of AOP
> when unit testing.
> 
> Is this just a technical matter, or is it politically
> (philosophically, theologically) wrong to try to perform unit testing
> on AOP components ?
> 
> Many thanks for any advice.
> 
> Mark

It very much depends on what you intend to test:
1/ the adviced code (you can use junit for this)
2/ the aspects themselves: at this junit is not offering to much help. maybe the new aUnit may help
here, even if it is in its incipient state.

:alex |.::the_mindstorm::.|
